title: 35th Anti-Aircraft Artillery Division (Soviet Union)
text:
The 35th Anti-Aircraft Artillery Division () was an <a href="Anti-Aircraft%20Artillery%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">anti-aircraft artillery division</a> of the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>'s <a href="Red%20Army">Red Army</a> (later the <a href="Soviet%20Army">Soviet Army</a>) during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> and the early postwar period.
World War II.
The 35th Anti-Aircraft Artillery Division of the <a href="Reserve%20of%20the%20Supreme%20High%20Command">Reserve of the High Command</a> (RGK) was formed between March and September 1943 at the Anti-Aircraft Artillery Training Camp in Moscow, part of the <a href="Moscow%20Military%20District">Moscow Military District</a>. Colonel Nikolai Salmin assumed command of the division on 15 July. After completing its formation, the division was railed to the front between 4 and 5 September in four echelons, joining the <a href="37th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">37th Army</a> of the <a href="Steppe%20Front">Steppe Front</a> (renamed the <a href="2nd%20Ukrainian%20Front">2nd Ukrainian Front</a> on 20 October). The division participated in the recapture of <a href="Left-bank%20Ukraine">Left-bank Ukraine</a> east of <a href="Kremenchug">Kremenchug</a>, the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Dnieper">Battle of the Dnieper</a>, and the offensive towards <a href="Krivoy%20Rog">Krivoy Rog</a> in late 1943. in January, the division and the 37th Army were transferred to the <a href="3rd%20Ukrainian%20Front">3rd Ukrainian Front</a> and fought in the <a href="Nikopol%E2%80%93Krivoi%20Rog%20offensive">Nikopol–Krivoy Rog offensive</a>, the <a href="Bereznegovatoye%E2%80%93Snigirevka%20offensive">Bereznegovatoye–Snigirevka offensive</a>, and the <a href="Odessa%20Offensive">Odessa offensive</a>. Salmin was evaluated as having "acted timidly, often losing control of divisional units on the march and in combat operations" during the army's actions in the <a href="Lyubotyn">Lyubotyn</a> region and the crossing of the <a href="Dnieper">Dnieper</a> and the <a href="Southern%20Bug">Southern Bug</a>. As a result, Salmin was relieved of command on 26 March 1944 and replaced by army deputy commander for air defense Colonel Mikhail Slyusarev. The 35th fought in the <a href="Second%20Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev%20offensive">Second Jassy–Kishinev offensive</a> and the occupation of Bulgaria. The division remained with the 37th Army occupying Bulgaria for the rest of the war.
Postwar.
The division was among those anti-aircraft artillery divisions disbanded without being converted into another unit by the end of the 1950s.
